intro: Hedlundia harziana, commonly known as the Harzian hedge-elder, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Hedlundia harziana is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
